metadata.title: Dutch lawmaker cancels Mohammad cartoon contest over safety concerns | Reuters
metadata.description: Dutch anti-Islam lawmaker Geert Wilders said on Thursday he was cancelling plans to hold a contest for cartoons caricaturing the Prophet Mohammad, saying the danger of violence against innocent people was too great.

nodes.title: Afghan Taliban urges retaliation over planned Dutch cartoon contest
nodes.cleanedCompare: taliban urged afghan soldiers thursday attack dutch troops serving nato-led resolute support mission retaliation contest cartoons depicting prophet mohammad planned far-right politician geert wilders urges cartoon

metadata.title: Afghan Taliban urges retaliation over planned Dutch cartoon contest | Reuters
metadata.description: The Taliban urged Afghan soldiers on Thursday to attack Dutch troops serving in the NATO-led Resolute Support mission in retaliation for a contest of cartoons depicting the Prophet Mohammad planned by far-right politician Geert Wilders.

metadata.title: UN Syria envoy floats idea of evacuating Idlib civilians | Fox News
metadata.description: Fearing a military offensive, the U.N. envoy for Syria proposed Thursday that civilians holed up in the rebel-held region of Idlib could evacuate to government areas — a move that would send many back into parts of Syria they once fled in its 7-1/2-year-old civil war.

metadata.title: Poland: Court vacancy disputed by chief justice holding seat | Fox News
metadata.description: Polish President Andrzej Duda has announced that the country's Supreme Court needs a new president even though the justice holding the job insists her term is not over and her colleagues support her. Duda co-authored recent regulations that require the high court's judges to retire at age 65.

metadata.title: Russia says it will hold war games this week - CBS News
metadata.description: NATO says the Russian navy is building up its presence in the Mediterranean Sea amid growing tensions over the war in Syria. Russia has provided crucial military support for Syrian government forces, which are expected to mount an offensive in the northern Idlib province, the last major rebel stronghold in the country.

metadata.title: French and English fishermen engage in "Scallop Wars" - CBS News
metadata.description: Over the centuries, France and Britain have fought more than two dozen wars. The latest battle erupted this week on the water, pitting fishing vessels against each other over scallops. CBS News' Elizabeth Palmer reports.

metadata.title: British, French fishermen clash in "Scallop Wars" - CBS News
metadata.description: Stones, flares and other objects -- along with insults -- were hurled as French fishing crews angry over U.K. access to scallop-rich waters off the Normandy coast confronted British boats in the English Channel.
